That's a great approach! Shopping local and seeking advice from knowledgeable staff can be a fantastic way to find unique pieces that fit your style and aesthetic. Don't be afraid to ask questions, and don't hesitate to share your vision and preferences with the staff. They can often provide valuable insights and recommendations that can help you find the perfect pieces.

**Additional Tips:**

1. **Bring a Picture:** Bring a picture of your placemats, dinnerware, and any other elements you're considering for your table setting. This can help the staff understand your aesthetic and make more informed recommendations.
2. **Be Open to Suggestions:** Keep an open mind and be willing to consider pieces that might not be exactly what you had in mind. The staff may suggest something that you hadn't thought of, but that ends up being the perfect fit.
3. **Ask About Custom Orders:** If you find a piece that's close to what you're looking for, but not quite right, ask if the store can special order something for you. Some stores may offer custom ordering services or be able to work with local artisans to create a piece that fits your needs.
4. **Check for Local Artisans:** Many local stores feature the work of local artisans. Ask if the store carries any pieces from local ceramicists or glassmakers who might be able to create custom pieces for you.

By following these tips and working with knowledgeable staff, you can find unique, earthy tone ceramics and glassware that fit your style and aesthetic. Good luck, and have fun exploring the local shopping scene!
